issue.title: Reproducibility issue with 0.18.0rc1
issue.body:
Now that gitian sigs are available for `0.18.0rc1`, we've got at least one set of reproducibly non-deterministic sigs (for the `riscv` and `aarch64` builds):

laanwj:
```
b9b5b4e8aca22e55743b028a8d55bf54c0364a61210b472f0d8e19efd8d23896  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz
05192e13f191c076af9dbc0554bb75f2c09084b634ad7323c08d1c124d17c709  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-aarch64-linux-gnu.tar.gz
0b1b1f4a36c6523cb54cefe0089566d2a5a3b24ad7c5625d00e76fbd0f430aac  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-riscv64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz
2c8ad57b3a0b9a21c920216150475138674eddfd1beca33600814435c2ce8cd2  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-riscv64-linux-gnu.tar.gz
```
laanwj tried rebuilding as well as rebuilding after [clearing the cache (219)](http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-03-05.html), and is still seeing the [same results (326)](http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-03-05.html).

[fanquake](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/pull/941), [achow101](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/pull/940), [jonasschnelli](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/pull/942), [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/pull/943):
```
3ee74310d156136b9ac4cd8da67c7ffc738ba3134ab4fcc225781f177721b075  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz
48dcd8bf5ce6d2d9d590f377f70d4ae4cb725a6f76a26d5b5c35c297d9396194  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-aarch64-linux-gnu.tar.gz
61f3a578a4ff5a5b0b1be5052426d0aa357df6254e105dbc317342c84143522f  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-riscv64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz
726e923b00c59ce68d84e4ef580cd95758c7e4124e216417c9e9807a33bd4043  bitcoin-0.18.0rc1-riscv64-linux-gnu.tar.gz
```
achow [build results](https://github.com/achow101/bitcoin/releases/tag/v0.18.0rc1)
jonas [linux build results](https://bitcointools.jonasschnelli.ch/data/builds/1007/)

events.body:
I've also tried rebuilding the base image. Interestingly this gives me a different output for both divergent platforms, but still different from the rest.

It looks like the `test_bitcoin` is the only diverging file for both platforms:
```
Binary files achow101/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin and laanwj/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin differ
Binary files achow101/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin and laanwj/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin differ
```

```
-rwxr-xr-x 1 user user 13791384 Mar  4 15:55 achow101/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin
-rwxr-xr-x 1 user user 12640464 Mar  4 15:55 achow101/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin
-rwxr-xr-x 1 user user 13791272 Mar  4 15:55 laanwj/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin
-rwxr-xr-x 1 user user 12640360 Mar  4 15:55 laanwj/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin
```

With my *old* (initial) build, `bitcoin-qt` was the one that differed
```
Binary files achow101/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt and laanwj2/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt differ
Binary files achow101/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt and laanwj2/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt differ
```
`test_bitcoin` curiously matches @achow101's

the difference seems to be minimal: presence/absence of .gnu_debuglink section
```diff
-achow101/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin:     file format elf64-little
+laanwj/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin:     file format elf64-little

 Contents of section .interp:
  0270 2f6c6962 2f6c642d 6c696e75 782d6161  /lib/ld-linux-aa
@@ -861626,6 +861626,3 @@
  0000 4743433a 20285562 756e7475 20382e32  GCC: (Ubuntu 8.2
  0010 2e302d31 7562756e 7475327e 31382e30  .0-1ubuntu2~18.0
  0020 34292038 2e322e30 00                 4) 8.2.0.
-Contents of section .gnu_debuglink:
- 0000 74657374 5f626974 636f696e 2e646267  test_bitcoin.dbg
- 0010 00000000 bee7a613                    ........
```

```diff
-achow101/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin:     file format elf64-little
+laanwj/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin:     file format elf64-little

 Contents of section .interp:
  0270 2f6c6962 2f6c642d 6c696e75 782d7269  /lib/ld-linux-ri
@@ -789682,6 +789682,3 @@
  0000 4743433a 20285562 756e7475 20382e32  GCC: (Ubuntu 8.2
  0010 2e302d31 7562756e 7475327e 31382e30  .0-1ubuntu2~18.0
  0020 34292038 2e322e30 00                 4) 8.2.0.
-Contents of section .gnu_debuglink:
- 0000 74657374 5f626974 636f696e 2e646267  test_bitcoin.dbg
- 0010 00000000 5c067f87                    ....\...
```

Same for the difference between *my own* two builds, but for `bitcoin-qt` !
```diff
-laanwj/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt:     file format elf64-little
+laanwj2/aarch/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt:     file format elf64-little

 Contents of section .interp:
  0270 2f6c6962 2f6c642d 6c696e75 782d6161  /lib/ld-linux-aa
@@ -2158828,6 +2158828,3 @@
  0000 4743433a 20285562 756e7475 20382e32  GCC: (Ubuntu 8.2
  0010 2e302d31 7562756e 7475327e 31382e30  .0-1ubuntu2~18.0
  0020 34292038 2e322e30 00                 4) 8.2.0.
-Contents of section .gnu_debuglink:
- 0000 62697463 6f696e2d 71742e64 62670000  bitcoin-qt.dbg..
- 0010 9347b4af                             .G..

-laanwj/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt:     file format elf64-little
+laanwj2/riscv/bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/bitcoin-qt:     file format elf64-little

 Contents of section .interp:
  0270 2f6c6962 2f6c642d 6c696e75 782d7269  /lib/ld-linux-ri
@@ -1846573,6 +1846573,3 @@
  0000 4743433a 20285562 756e7475 20382e32  GCC: (Ubuntu 8.2
  0010 2e302d31 7562756e 7475327e 31382e30  .0-1ubuntu2~18.0
  0020 34292038 2e322e30 00                 4) 8.2.0.
-Contents of section .gnu_debuglink:
- 0000 62697463 6f696e2d 71742e64 62670000  bitcoin-qt.dbg..
- 0010 ea8590d6                             ....
```
So the good news is: there's no divergence in the actual code generation.
It looks like a race condition around *adding* this section? Sometimes it's added, sometimes it isn't.
This is supposed to happen in `contrib/devtools/split-debug.sh.in`:
```bash
@OBJCOPY@ --enable-deterministic-archives -p --add-gnu-debuglink=$3 $2
```

I'm working on a patch so that failures in the `contrib/devtools/split-debug.sh.in` script will cause the build to fail. Currently due to `find -exec` semantics these go silently ignored (well maybe not silently, it will likely log something, but who digs into that every time).

Ok that worked, it turns out it was indeed a local issue (it's strange as there's 16G free on the disk, but ok… maybe some VM restriction, yes I see the default size for the LXC disk is 10240MB maybe that's no longer enough):
```
+ xargs -0 -n1 '-I{}' ../contrib/devtools/split-debug.sh '{}' '{}' '{}.dbg'
/usr/bin/aarch64-linux-gnu-objcopy:bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin.dbg[.debug_info]: No space left on device
/usr/bin/aarch64-linux-gnu-objcopy:bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/stIxfQNI: cannot fill debug link section `bitcoin-0.18.0rc1/bin/test_bitcoin.dbg': No such file or directory
```
Will submit a PR that adds proper error handling, so that these kinds of issues won't be a hidden problem in the future.

issue.title: gitian: Improve error handling
issue.body:
Improve error handling in gitian builds:

- Set fail-on-error and pipefail flag, this causes a command to fail when either of the pipe stages fails, not only when the last of the stages fails, so this improves error detection.
- Also use `xargs` instead of `find -exec`, because `find` will not propagate errors in the executed command, but `xargs` will.

This will avoid some issues like #15541 where non-determinism is silently introduced due to errors caused by environment conditions (such as lack of disk space in that case).

events.body:
Ok, managed to reproduce the common gitian sigs now in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/commit/1b4b22304860476b7151757a25c5ae281bb7b19e

See  #15549 for changes that would make this failure more apparent.

issue.title: build: Default size for the LXC disk is no longer enough
issue.body:
My favorite configuration for gitian building is Linux Mint 19.1 (based on Ubuntu 18.04) with LXC 3.0.3.

Faced disk space issues. This `gitian-builder` patch works well:
```
diff --git a/bin/make-base-vm b/bin/make-base-vm
index 916c11f..152f8bc 100755
--- a/bin/make-base-vm
+++ b/bin/make-base-vm
@@ -264,7 +264,7 @@ if [ $LXC = "1" ]; then
       fi
     fi
   fi
-  dd if=/dev/zero of=$OUT-lxc bs=1M count=1 seek=10240
+  dd if=/dev/zero of=$OUT-lxc bs=1M count=1 seek=15360
   /sbin/mkfs.ext4 -F $OUT-lxc
   t=`mktemp -d gitian.XXXXXXXX`
   sudo mount $OUT-lxc $t
```

Refs:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/15541#issuecomment-470160960 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15549#issuecomment-470330012 by @laanwj 
- https://github.com/devrandom/gitian-builder/pull/172 by @luke-jr

issue.title: Increase the LXC disk size from 10241 MiB to 12 GiB
issue.body:
Since 1ae746f68f0e4409197365f775defd9ae901a96c, the LXC disk size is still 10241 MiB.
There are reports about related issues while building Bitcoin Core:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/15541#issuecomment-470160960
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/15574

Over time, the sizes of both the Bitcoin Core repository and the cache have been increased. Some target architectures have been added.

This PR increases the LXC disk size from 10241 MiB to 12 GiB (originally suggested by @laanwj).

**Note for reviewers:** There is another [suggestion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15549#issuecomment-470330012) from @laanwj:
>  or make the descriptor clean up the intermediate result after each host build.

As every new build is preceded by creating a fresh clean LXC image:
https://github.com/devrandom/gitian-builder/blob/63fe5d1de2a03e1d9b12b27e195753694487119a/libexec/make-clean-vm#L62
this suggestion seems to be not working.
